result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarred Allen Mortenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

Defendant is to pay restitution in the amount to be determined at Restitution Hearing on August 12, 2022. Restitution to be joint and several with co-defendant Derick Mortenson, Trempealeau County Case No. 22CF10.

8-12-22 IT IS ORDERED: The defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $784.99 plus a 10% surcharge. To be joint and several as mentioned above.

records.addlTxt: 11:04 AM DA Sacia appears in person for the state. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Tainter appears in person. Defense advised not contesting restitution. State presents restitution amount. Court advised defendant of right to contest. Defendant agrees with restitution. Restitution to be joint and several with co-defendant, Derick Mortenson (22CF10). Court approves request/stipulation. State to file order.

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jarred Allen Mortenson in court, in custody.  Attorney Greg A Tainter in court for Jarred Allen Mortenson. Joint recommendation presented to the court. Court requests explanation for recommendation. Defense provides explanation. State adds to explanation. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant KVI waives all rights. Defendant enters G plea to count 4 and count 5. Court finds defendant G of count 4 and count 5. Defendant sentenced. Count 1, count 2 and count 3 are DRI. RSH set.

records.addlTxt:
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination- Jarred A. Mortenson
The original history event date is: 01-26-2022
Adjourned initial appearance on February 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess weapons or ammunition.  Defendant is to have no contact with N.T.M. and A.L.F, their residences or places of employment.  Defendant is to have no contact with Grandview Apartments in the City of Blair, WI.  Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol and is not to enter bars or taverns, or any place where alcohol is sold or served for on-premises consumption.   Defendant is not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription.   Defendant is not to possess drug paraphernalia.

ADA Diaz appeared by video for the State;  Def appeared in custody, without counsel, by video from the Tremp. Co. Jail.  Court reads complaint aloud to Def.  Court advised Def of all rights.  Def understands rights.  Def wishes to waive time limits for PH.  Court finds Def KVI waives time limits for PH.  AIA set.  Bond set.
